constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type: AIRPORTDescription: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

description: Erection of single storey rear extension to existing garage and part conversion of garage into a gym.
decision_conditions: In addition please provide specifications or manufacturers brochures of the proposed windows, doors and roof lights which are part of your application

The proposed extension and alterations are not considered to fall within the parameters of  permitted development as set out under schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as this applies to extensions to dwellinghouse and not to outbuildings. The proposed extension and alterations are not considered to fall within the parameters of  permitted development as set out under schedule 2, Part 1, Class E.1 (e) (ii) of the Town and County Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015.Which states:E.1 Development is not permitted by Class E if -(e) the height of the building, enclosure or container would exceed -(ii) 2.5 metres in the case of a building, enclosure or container within 2 metres of the boundary of the curtilage of the dwellinghouse,

Anyone who takes, damages or destroys the nest of any wild bird whilst that nest is in use or being built is guilty of an offence under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 and prior to commencing work you should ensure that no nesting birds will be affected.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Given that the Birch in question is a mature specimen which appears never to have received reductive work historically and remains healthy; the works proposed are excessive and due to the species characteristics and the maturity of the tree in combination, may well lead to the tree entering into decline.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1 Birch - Reduce single overextended limb presenting to the upper western canopy and a second overextended limb presenting to the upper North Eastern canopy back to suitable growth points in line with main canopy, 10% crown thin & deadwood.
